title: Conservative Icon Charles MacKenzie Dies – ‘Revered For His Vision And Courage’
text:
Former Democratic Congressman Gets 10 Years In Prison For ‘Widespread Criminal Activity’ 
“Little Grove City College feels like David confronting Goliath as it challenges the government bureaucracy. It is fighting for everyone’s freedoms and not merely its own,” said MacKenzie on the steps of the Supreme Court. 
MacKenzie —“Sherry” to his friends — is fondly remembered by those he mentored, taught and worked with during his time in education. 
“Dr. MacKenzie will be long remembered and revered for his vision and courage as a leader, his outstanding intellect as a scholar and teacher, and his extraordinary warmth and kindness as a pastor,” said current Grove City College President Paul McNulty. Advertisement - story continues below 
“He touched countless lives over the course of his remarkable career in the church and higher education,” McNulty continued. 
“He was a transformational mentor to me when I was a student under his care and offered unwavering support in my current role. While I will greatly miss him, he is now in the presence of his Savior where he has most certainly longed to be,” he added. 
MacKenzie served as president of the college from 1971 to 1991 and during that time managed to increase enrollment, update the college’s curriculum and complete $38 million in campus improvements, all while keeping the school debt-free. 
“I am a better person for having known Sherry both as a student and during my early tenure on the Board,” said David Rathburn, chairman of college’s Board of Trustees. Advertisement - story continues below
